hypothesis.title: Magnetar giant flare hypothesis
hypothesis.description: FRBs are caused by giant flares from magnetars, similar to soft gamma repeaters but in radio.
hypothesis.statement: Magnetars with ultra‑strong magnetic fields undergo crustal fractures, producing intense radio bursts.
assumptions: FRB sources are young, highly magnetized neutron stars.

predictions.description: FRBs should be accompanied by X‑ray counterparts.

hypothesis.falsification_conditions: Absence of X‑ray emission in nearby FRBs, or detection of a non‑magnetar signature.
